text: Fannegusha Creek is a stream in Carroll and Holmes counties in east-central Mississippi. It is a tributary to the Blissdale Swamp.Howard, MS, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 1982 The stream headwaters arise in Carroll County at at an elevation of approximately 380 feet.Murdock Lake, MS, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 1975 (1982 rev.) The stream flows to the southwest into Holmes County passing under Mississippi Highway 17 and Mississippi Highway 12 north and northeast of Lexington. It is channelized as it enters the Blissdale Swamp within the Hillside National Wildlife Sanctuary 3.5 miles southeast of Tchula and one mile northwest of the community of Howard.Mississippi Atlas and Gazetteer, DeLorme, 4th ed., 2010, pp. 35-6 The stream ends at at an elevation of 125 feet. Fannegusha is a name derived from the Choctaw language purported to mean "tasty squirrel". Variant names for Fannegusha Creek are "Foney Bush Creek", "Funnegusha Creek", and "Funnigusha Creek". ==References== Category:Rivers of Mississippi Category:Bodies of water of Holmes County, Mississippi Category:Bodies of water of Carroll County, Mississippi
title: Fannegusha Creek (Blissdale Swamp tributary)
